definition: lifeblood/the thing that one cherishes most in life/(coll.) family jewels (male genitals)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: But credit is the lifeblood of the car business.
sentences.chinese: 但信貸的確是汽車產業的命根子。

sentences.english: The boy is the lifeblood of his parents.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩是他父母的命根子。

sentences.english: And Barr said, 'I'm gonna stick my penis in that thing.'
sentences.chinese: 而巴爾說，‘我要把我的命根子插到那東西里。’

sentences.english: These words hit at the core of him .
sentences.chinese: 這話彷彿一拳打中了他的命根子。

sentences.english: The whole internet knowing we've got a small penis.
sentences.chinese: 如果網上所有人都知道我們的命根子很小。

sentences.english: Scrooge say that money is the lifeblood, who at the time was hard life.
sentences.chinese: 守財奴說金錢是命根，勤奮者看時間是生命。

sentences.english: Enthusiasm is the lifeblood of creativity.

definition: lower body/euphemism for genitals/root and stem of plants
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
(of a child) apple of one's eye
erhua variant of 屁眼[pi4 yan3]
